q: Chrysler emerged from bankruptcy in June 2009 and is now under the management control of Italy's Fiat SpA, which has a 25 percent stake in the U.S. automaker. Sergio Marchionne is also CEO of Fiat. As the only parties willing to underwrite the risk associated with Chrysler's recovery plan, the two governments levied interest rates that, although appropriate at the time, are above current market conditions, Sergio Marchionne said. "I regret the remark," Sergio Marchionne said in a statement posted on Chrysler's website. As the only parties willing to underwrite the risk associated with Chrysler's recovery plan, the two governments levied interest rates that, although appropriate at the time, are above current market conditions. Chrysler is paying "shyster rates" to government lenders of last resort because banks reduced credit during the recession in 2008 and 2009, Sergio Marchionne said. Democrats now wonder what the president will say and whether he will be willing to marginalize the left of the party to shore up his position among independents as his reelection operation gears up in Chicago. That's a very good question, Sen. Bernie Sanders ( I-Vt.) said Monday when asked whether Barack Obama might alienate more progressive lawmakers by overreaching to the right. Sen.
